term.title: glyco-amino-acid

item.text: A saccharide attached to a single amino acid by any kind of covalent bond. A glycosyl-amino-acid is a compound consisting of saccharide linked through a glycosyl linkage (O-, N-, or S-) to an amino acid.

notes.item: The hyphens are needed to avoid implying that the carbohydrate is necessarily linked to the amino group.
